The website uses themes to provide the layout and graphics the client actually sees, the so called views. This makes it easy to provide a set of different user interfaces without changing much of the underlying backend.

Themes can be found in themes/ in which every theme has its sub directory. There must always be at least one theme present which is named default (themes/default/). The default theme provides the standard look and feel of the website. Other themes can be added but it is not necessary to implement all the specified views, images or emails. Whenever a view, image or email can't be found in a theme the ones in the default theme are used.

A theme directory looks like this:

  • themes/name/
    • email/
      • agenda_add.txt
      • agenda_cancel.txt
      • agenda_mod.txt
      • document_add.txt
      • document_cancel.txt
      • editable_del.txt
      • editable_edit.txt
      • links_add.txt
      • links_cancel.txt
      • taken_assign.txt
      • taken_mod.txt
    • images/
      • accept.png
      • add.png
      • ...
    • styles/
      • agenda.css
      • almanak.css
      • ...
    • views/
      • footer.php
      • header.php
      • ...
    • style.css
